reviews.author: NOOB_IN_UST
reviews.title: Morris wanted to teach us differently, but he needs to improve his teaching skills
reviews.comment_content:
The content of ACCT3210 should be "Advanced Managerial Accounting", however, about half of them are the same as ACCT2200  Principles of Accounting II.
In the first lecture, Morris said he wanted to teach differently. He talked about the costing of selling coffee, and even making coffee in front of the class. He even said "I am an economist which is going to teach accounting. We can easily replace accounting professors..." That gave me great hope at first.

But turns out he was trash in teaching, in a different way.
He said that last year when he was teaching ACCT2200, many students wrote badly in SFQ and commented that he was only reading PowerPoint slides. Thus this year he just used Excel files and Jupyter Notebook files to teach costing. That was a good try, but still fail to address the main issue: teaching skills.

He failed to explain costing clearly. And with the extra contents of coding (many students do not have such skills and knowledge in Numpy, Matlpotlib, Scipy, sklearn, Pandas, statsmodels, Seaborn...), everyone just wants to die. Lucky for me, this semester I was also studying ACCT4720 Equity Investment with Machine learning, which give me plenty of experience to handle the coding contents in the lecture.

Besides, the choice of the textbook is bad:
1. Many typos and mistakes in the textbooks and exercise.
2. Does not include a summary of equations in each chapter like many other textbooks do.
reviews.comment_teaching:
I know Morris wanted to teach differently, but he did not have sufficient teaching skills. I strongly recommend him to get a PGDE.

After March, he stopped providing lecture recordings.
reviews.comment_grading:
Participation 10%
A pure black box with no disclosure.

Group Work 20%
4 group works, two of them are textbook questions with answers provided. The rest is coding and short questions. Very easy to get full marks.

Mid term 20%
I don't know why but I got above mean. Questions are somewhat easy to do but time costly.

Final exam 50%
The full mark is 776, of which half of them are the same questions in the mid term exam.

The final grading model is still a black box grading model, darker than the black hole. I fucked up many questions in the final exam, but still end up getting an A+, the best grade course in the UST!!
For your reference I got C+ in Financial Accounting and Company Law, thus I am skilful in management as I am a master of creative accounting! HAHAHA
reviews.comment_workload:
To be honest, I paid little attention to this course.

Group assignment 3 "Cost Model Case Assignment" cost me a lot of time and effort in coding. But the rest group assignment, they costed less than 1 hour.

I only spent a few hours before the mid term exam, and 2 days before the final exam with many chapters skipped. Turns out the 4-hour long exam is barely enough for me to finish the exam, and I was the last one in the zoom to submit the exam.

reviews.author: lc09
reviews.title: There is no difference between reading slides and reading codes
reviews.comment_content: Basically very similar to ACCT2200, plus some data analytics using Python or Excel in the first half of course. I don't think there are any "advanced" concept taught. Most of the topics are very common sense.
reviews.comment_teaching:
1. He said someone complained him reading slides in previous years, and switched to use Python for the first half of course. However, this does not change the fact that he is reading aloud the Python. For the second half, the concepts are more qualitative and hence he switched to read aloud slides.

2. He tried to keep everyone attentive in Zoom by having 10% participation mark and requiring all people to turn on the camera. No lecture video published after class. However, he stopped requiring ppl turning on camera in March under COVID outbreak and allow ppl to watch lecture video afterwards. Still, it is a waste of time to watch the lecture video in 1.5 speed.

3. He tried to apply daily examples when teaching and said that the textbook is outdated. However, given that the course are actually teaching common-sense concepts, his example does not really provide any insights on the topic.

4. He hesitates quite a lot during the lecture.

5. In the second half of course, he read aloud slides very quickly and finish all classes within 1 hour. However, it's even faster if you read the slides yourself.
reviews.comment_grading:
10% participation - Attendance. No information on how many points you would lose if you miss 1 lecture. (It's really funny that advance ACCT course has attendance requirement)

20% group project - 4 in total. Basically you can get full mark if you submit something that's not too seriously wrong, even if your group member free-ride (it's a "managerial skill" to motivate them)

20% mid-term:
- 70% Canvas quiz requiring numeric answers only
- 20% simple data analytic question by Excel and Python
- 10% open-ended short essay-type question (1 very short question)

50% final - Canvas quiz VERY similar to mid-term. The question wordings are nearly identical. The Excel question is directly copied from midterm. Plus, there are some essay type questions like "Explain what is decentralization" where he expects people to directly copy from textbook. Basically he paid no effort for thinking questions.
reviews.comment_workload:
Don't put too much effort in group project as you would get full mark anyway if you answers are not too wrong. There is no effort credit. Still, it's a waste of time for communicating in group as he would randomly assign new group members for EVERY group assignment.

Besides group project, the workload is acceptable

reviews.comment_teaching:
Someone thinks Morris is not good at teaching. For me I think his teaching style suits me. He tries to use many examples to raise the main message of the topic. He also teaches some practical skills that we need as a managerial accountant. Some students think learning Excel or Python is not appropriate in this Accounting course, but personally I see no problem as Morris doesn't dig deep into it.
He is also a passionate and helpful teacher. After receiving feedback about the workload and assignments, Morris immediately changes the assignments into grade by submission. He also shortens the course syllabus after receiving feedback. I strongly recommend choosing Morris.

reviews.comment_teaching: He is passionate about teaching and wants to teach differently. However, the deliverables and explanations are not clear. He likes to explain the concepts using python and Excel.
reviews.comment_workload:
Class Participation
He randomly picks students by using his own designed Python code to answer a question during the class. Of course, if you don’t know the answer, you still get participation marks. But in the whole course, most of the students were only picked once. So most students should get full participation scores.

Cases and Problems
There are a total of 14 problems and 3 cases. Many of them are quite difficult and time-consuming. Students will need to use Excel or Python to do the questions. However, if students submitted the problems, then will get full points.

Midterm
closed book exam and no need calculator
There are five sections and only the best four sections will be counted. So students can skip one section.
4 sections will be the short question and they are just referring to the questions in problems/cases.
1 section will be the multiple-choice questions.
So the midterm is relatively easy and the mean is so high.

Final Exam
closed book exam and no need calculator
There are two sections and each section contains 6 parts. Only the best 5 parts of each session will be counted. So students can skip 1 of the 6 parts in each session.
The first session was told to be the same as the midterm contents. So if you can remember all the midterm questions and answers, you will get high marks.
The second session covers mainly the contents in the second half of the course. Questions are referring to the problems, cases and lecture slides.

Exam
In fact, i don't know what actually have to read for revision. As many exam questions are similar to/same as the problems/cases, recitation may be a good choice to do revision.

Dr. WANG, Zhihong is a visiting scholar from Clark University (USA) so she was staying here in UST just for this semester. She explained the concepts quite clearly and went through examples at an acceptable pace. Sometimes when students could not grasp the concepts well, she would explain them again. So she was quite patient.

However, sometimes she was too enthusiastic about accounting and things going on in the business world that she would spend quite a lot of time talking about them, out-of-class topics you know... and wasted quite some time. Basically you can skip the first 15 minutes of every lecture because only after that would she start talking about the class materials.
reviews.comment_grading:
5% Participation (just attendance in class, you are allowed to skip two lectures without penalty; and she really wanted people to turn the camera on haha)
15% Course project (dunno why ACCT has projects lol...)
35% Midterm Exam (MC + Long questions)
45% Final Exam (same as midterm)
reviews.comment_workload:
Not bad. For the course project you have to think of a startup idea about a catering business on the UST campus. You have to include cost breakdowns, products offered, pro-forma income statements in different formats and the balanced scorecard. The final report is 10 pages long, double-spaced and excluding cover page, appendix and references. There is also a presentation of 10 minutes for each group.

Others are just so-and-so.

reviews.author: Godfrey
reviews.title: Poor Professor
reviews.comment_content:
Understand the importance of some management accounting for corporates’ strategic and
operational decisions and the drawbacks of misusing management accounting information and
techniques including advanced variance analysis, balanced scorecard,etc
reviews.comment_teaching: He basically cannot speak fluent English fluently. It is better to read the powerpoint yourself atclass.
reviews.comment_grading: midterms and exams are difficult especially when there is an online exam. Since people were able to cheat back then, the mean was so high. Thus, I made up my mind to apply P/F grading instead.
reviews.comment_workload: Quite heavy since you have to submit homework weekly and there are several group assignments and presentations occasionally.

reviews.author: Jackie0925
reviews.title: A fair course
reviews.comment_content: The content itself is fine. It includes typical costing topics (such as cost allocation, linear programming, variance analysis etc.).
reviews.comment_teaching: The teaching is a very bare pass. Important details are covered but the teaching is not effective at all. He just went through most chapters with 1 example, which is definitely insufficient. The microphone often goes wrong and he often has meaning fillers (er, um, well, you know...). I feel that at least 3 examples can be taught if the teaching is more effective. Anyhow, he is friendly and willing to answer students' questions.
reviews.comment_grading:
Class attendance / participation 5%
Homework assignments 7%
Group Assignments 18%
Midterm exam 25%
Final exam 45%

The grading is normal accounting course. Around 25% A-range and 45% B-range. The midterm exam and final exam are the main factors determining the final grade.

The midterm and final are so hard and insufficient time is given. The mean is only 69% and 51% respectively.

Approximate overall score in the class and respective grading
Above 1sd --> A
Above 0.7sd --> A-
Above 0.3sd --> B+
Mean --> B
Below 0.4sd --> B-
Below 0.8sd --> C+
reviews.comment_workload: The group assignments are quite useless and time-consuming. The homework assignments are just graded by submission. I guess the homework assignments can help us to do revision. Also, there are extra recommended exercise

reviews.author: hjk
reviews.title: Advanced Management Accounting Review (Online)
reviews.comment_content:
The course expands the learning of managerial accounting which was introduced in ACCT 2200. The course content is based mostly on the textbook which students had to access by purchasing an e-book due to the situation this semester. Some of the major topics:
- Cost concepts
- Product mix decision
- Balanced scorecard
- Variance analysis
- Allocation of support department cost
- Transfer pricing
- Performance measurement
Using excel for accounting analytics is also introduced but not tested.
Relatively easy compared to financial accounting courses. But you definitely have to understand the concepts and how to solve the problems - practice makes perfect.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor is very nice, and responds to questions in and out of class actively. He mainly uses the powerpoint slides like any other professors, but he makes sure students do lots of practices so that we get the concept. He will go through sample questions during class and encourages participation. Unfortunately, I felt that there were always some technical problems with his audio during Zoom lectures.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading scheme is something like this:
- Attendance/participation 5%
- HW 7%
- Group Assignment 18%
- Midterm 25%
- Final 45%
It's a bit weird that there would be group assignment in an accounting course, and that it accounts 18% which is not negligible. It is based on course concept and some analytics and should not be really that difficult although our group screwed up. The homework assignment is practice questions from textbook which you just have to submit for credit. Both midterm and final went online this semester, and the means were quite low... like 70/100 for midterm and 50/100 for final. Fortunately I did pretty well for the final and got an A. Again, practice makes perfect.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is average. The homework assignments are weekly, but not as demanding as they are not marked, but solutions are released later for students to practice. The group assignment was tricky in my opinion, as students had to collaborate to complete total 4 in-and-out of class assignments. The final wasn't cumulative so there aren't that much for the final. However, all the exams were open-book this semester, so I cannot say the difficulty would be the same for future semesters.

reviews.author: Tommy=]

reviews.comment_teaching:
A very funny guy.

Tony always updates his lecture notes but not upload the latest one on canvas. Moreover, he always makes updates. For example, he even updated his syllabus for 4 times.

But remember, please attend the class! Sometimes, Tony update lecture notes without uploading the latest version on canvas. Therefore, you have to attend every class to ensure you won't miss out any important items.
reviews.comment_grading:
Class attendance/participation: 5%
In-class exercise 15%
Midterm 35%
Final 45%

My midterm score: 95.5/100
Final: unknown, I believe my final exam was screwed up

But finally got A-, I heard that Tony has argue with ACCT dept about giving more A range, so he was a bit late to distribute grades to students.
reviews.comment_workload:
In-class exercise is made by Tony (I believe). The in-class exercise is worked in group, therefore, it is soooo important to find some good groupmates. Fortunately, I had a dualer as my groupmate, he carried the whole group in this course.

For midterm, I remembered that there are a question about using p-value/t-value. Please Please Please recite the paragraph on textbook. Moreover, please also recite the content of balanced scorecard, since Tony will ask 1 question about this topic. I remember there is a question very similar to first in-class exercise. Please remember to capture all answers and formula during in-class exercise lessons~ I think rest of the questions are very similar to textbook exercises.

For final exam, Tony allows us to bring a cheat sheet. Remember to put down the double-entry of handling joint cost. There is a question asking you to write double entry on joint cost. This part will only be taught in lecture. Please attend the class la!!! Final exam is much harder than in-class exercise and textbook exercise. Therefore, you better have more practice before exam.

reviews.author: Dreamscometrue
reviews.comment_content:
Starting with the basic concepts learnt in ACCT2200, then move to advanced level of cost accounting topics.

The first part is actually a statistic course. We need to understand the basic linear regression knowledge. All other topics are playing around with numbers.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Generally speaking, his teaching is fine. However, many content he metioned in class are not on the ppt. He illustrates in class, but was not always effective. Many students could not get what he is talking about in lectures.

One point to note: he loves changing the powerpoint slides again and again. If you have printed it out at the beginning, you will eventually notice that you have to print again.
reviews.comment_grading:
Very good grading indeed.

Heard that midterm below 1 sd can still get B range
reviews.comment_workload:
6 in class exercises with fluctuating difficulties. It is very annoying since sometimes he will just project the questions out.

1 mid-term: One of the questions is very tricky (but not difficult). Time given is very inadequate.

1 final: The paper is very difficult and long. Not enough time given again.

No project this year.

Ch2 CVP Analysis
Ch3 Estimations and Applications of Cost Functions

Ch8 Allocation of Support Department Costs

reviews.comment_teaching: Professor's teaching is great with much passion. He is also funny that you will not get bored in class. You need to attend every lessons as there is class participation that he will mark down the person that has answered his questions.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is very very good. He is very kind and he said we made good job in midterm.

Class Participation  15%
In class group exercise  10%
Group project and presentation  10%
Midterm  35%
Final  40%

You need to actively answer questions and he will mark down in order to get credit for class participation. Also, he knows who is missing in the class.

There is 7 in class group exercises. The group will be the same as the group for your project. About every two classes, you have one in class exercise. Your group is given about 20 minutes to finish a comprehensive problem with calculations and explanation.

For group project, you need to find an article related to how a company uses management accounting concept to overcome  its challenge. You only need to submit the powerpoint slides for what the article mention, and present in class.

Midterm Mean 83/100 SD 10

Final mark is unknown.

I get full mark is in class exercise, 95/100 in midterm.

Finally, I got A+.
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is not high as there is no assignment during the semester. Project can be prepared one week before presentation.

However, there are too many questions in both midterm and final. You need to do quickly so that you can finish the exams on time. Also, the questions in final are quite tough. Be sure you understand all the concepts before.
